item.title: Polish voters set for tight presidential race after 10 years of Duda
item.description: Sunday's first-round is expected to set up a run-off between Warsaw's liberal mayor and a conservative historian.

item.title: Gabon's ousted president and family freed after two years and fly to Angola
item.description: Sylvia Bongo and her son was freed from prison last week despite facing charges of embezzling public funds.

item.title: Is there a genocide of white South Africans as Trump claims?
item.description: US President Donald Trump says a genocide is taking place in South Africa, a claim a judge dismissed as "imaginary".

item.title: Tigray party says ban threatens Ethiopia peace deal
item.description: The TPLF fought a two-year civil war against the federal government, which ended in 2022.

item.title: Ancient Indian skeleton gets a museum home six years after excavation
item.description: The skeleton had been kept in a makeshift shed since its excavation in 2019 due to bureaucratic wrangling.
